page.title: 12AGRICULTURAL MACHINERY
page.content:
{ AGRICULTURAL MACHINERY } {LEIGH AND BRANSFORD
Originally there were two work- shops for the repair of agricultural machinery but the one at Bransford began to diversify into the production of new machines in 1975. The business changed hands in 1982 and now concent- rates solely on making plant potting machines and similar original designs for the nursery business.
The machinery is intended to be of particular use in 'third world' countries and thus attention is paid to ease of servicing. Exports go mainly to the Middle East and the firm exhibits in Europe, as well as Britain. There are four employees.
